definition.name: mul

text.english:
Let \( \texttt{mul} : \mathcal{N}Term \to \mathcal{N}Term \) be defined as follows:
  • Base Clause: \( \texttt{mul}(Z, m) = m \)
  • Inductive Clause: \( \texttt{mul}(S(n), m) = \texttt{add}(\texttt{mul}(n,m), m) \).
text.italiano:
Sia \( \texttt{mul} : \mathcal{N}Term \to \mathcal{N}Term \) definito come segue:
  • Clausola Base: \( \texttt{mul}(Z, m) = m \)
  • Clausola Induttiva: \( \texttt{mul}(S(n), m) = \texttt{add}(\texttt{mul}(n,m), m) \).

definition.coq: Fixpoint mul (n m : nterm) : nterm := match n with | Z => Z | S n' => add (mul n' m) m end.
